text: the President of the United States so
president Trump offered this sort of
second big speech of his presidency the
first one being the inaugural address a
new national pride is sweeping across
our nation this was his first speech to
a joint session of Congress and it
really was a very different a different
moment than that first speech the
inaugural speech was really dark
what we are witnessing today is the
renewal of the American spirit this was
a much more optimistic speech the tone
was much less dark and President Trump
really did two things he recounted in
about half of the speech the things that
he sees that he's achieved during just
the first few weeks of his presidency my
administration has answered the pleas of
the American people for immigration
enforcement and border security we are
also taking strong measures to protect
our nation from radical Islamic
terrorism and then the second half of
the speech was really a kind of effort
to say where do we want to go as a
country and it was a very traditional
speech in that regard I will be asking
Congress to approve legislation that
produces a 1 trillion dollar investment
in infrastructure of the United States
financed through both public and private
capital creating millions of new jobs
right so the reaction to the speech was
what you would expect this was the first
time that House Speaker Paul Ryan and of
course the Vice President Mike Pence
were sitting in the traditional seats
behind President Trump and the chamber
of course whenever the president said
something that you know sort of tapped
into the typical Republican orthodoxy
repeal and replace Obamacare caused the
you know entire side of the chamber
where the Republicans were sitting to
rise up and give him a standing ovation
most of those times you saw their
Democrats sitting on their hands
essentially
there were definitely a couple of
moments where you'd see you know
Democratic lawmakers maybe putting a
thumbs-down sign when he talked about
repealing Obamacare there was this one
moment when President Trump singled out
the widow of William Ryan Owens Ryan's
legacy is etched into eternity
thank you part of it was the typical
emotional moment that that oftentimes
presidents strive to have in these kinds
of set speeches they're largely boring
speeches who wants a moment that tugs at
the heartstrings his performance raises
a question about whether this is going
to be a kind of single moment in which
he diverts from the way his presidency
has been and it really doesn't amount to
anything and he goes back to being the
Donald Trump that we all know who's
tweeting at 5:30 in the morning and in
sort of a White House kind of in chaos
and omission all sorts of problems if it
signals a shift towards a more
traditional kind of presidency you know
we may we may weeks and months and years
down the road we may look back and say
oh that was that that was that first
speech to the joint session of Congress
and that was when it all changed we'll
see
